results.1-1: Duty. It is my solemn duty to protect my charge. (Lawful)
results.2-2: Survival. Just as people pay for food and shelter, paying for protection is just another way to trade resources for survival. (Neutral)
results.3-3: Deception. The longer all eyes are fixed on my charge, the longer it will take them to notice what I’m up to. (Evil)
results.4-4: Sacrifice. I will gladly give my life to protect someone who can do more for the greater good than I can. (Good)
results.5-5: Unpredictability. The best way to protect someone is to make sure their behavior can’t be predicted. (Chaotic)
results.6-6: Reward. The best part about a dangerous job is that it usually pays well. (Any)

results.1-1: I am hyper vigilant and don’t know how to relax.
results.2-2: I snore loud enough to wake the dead.
results.3-3: I have a furious temper that is easily provoked.
results.4-4: I get irritable if I don’t have a soft bed or a full belly.
results.5-5: I tend to gamble away most of the money I make.

results.1-1: I never wash my hands. They’re just going to get dirty again.
results.2-2: I never let go of a grudge.
results.3-3: I make as much of a mess when I eat as when I ply my trade.
results.4-4: I struggle to find meaning in life. We’re no more special than the animals we eat.
results.5-5: I beat myself up even for small mistakes.
results.6-6: I have no confidence in the abilities of my allies.

results.1-1: When things get too stressful, I tend to wander off without telling anyone.
results.3-3: I can never relax while indoors; I crave the open sky.
results.4-4: I’m tempted to indulge in illicit pleasures wherever I go—the more illicit, the better.
results.5-5: I get extremely irritable when I’m tired.
results.6-6: My stories get increasingly exaggerated the more I tell them.

results.1-1: I smile even in the face of great danger or discomfort.
results.2-2: I am uncomfortable with silence and go out of my way to avoid it.
results.3-3: I despise being interrupted when I’m working.
results.4-4: I need new and exciting experiences to keep me from getting bored.
results.6-6: I do my best to stay on the cutting edge of style and fashion.
results.7-7: When I cut someone’s hair, I expect people to recognize my work.
results.8-8: My services do not come cheaply, and I’m not afraid to say it.

results.1-1: I like to ask uncomfortable questions to make people squirm.
results.2-2: I voice my opinions to anyone anywhere without regard to the audience or situation.
results.3-3: The smallest slights against me sometimes keep me up at night.
results.4-4: My reputation is more important than anything else about me.
results.5-5: I’m always eating something and frequently talk with my mouth full.
results.6-6: Some people might think it’s creepy that I secretly keep locks of hair from my patrons.

results.1-1: I learned my trade from my parents. I took up the cleaver to honor them.
results.2-2: I genuinely respect the sacrifices made by the animals we eat.
results.3-3: I keep the tools of my trade in impeccable condition. An artisan is only as good as their tools.
results.4-4: My community is very important to me, and I occupy a valuable place in that community.
results.5-5: I am always looking for exotic new meats to sample and learn about.
results.6-6: I owe a favor to the people who helped me get started in my trade.

results.2-2: I love animals, but people need to eat.
results.3-3: When confronted by good fortune, I am always waiting for the other shoe to drop.
results.4-4: A knife is best when it’s useful; the same is true of people.
results.5-5: I can rise to any challenge if I try hard enough.
results.6-6: If someone is nice to you, they’re just trying to trick you.
results.7-7: Sharing gossip and news is an important part of any society.
results.8-8: I never tell the whole truth if I can help it.

results.1-1: Function. Farmers harvest. Hunters hunt. Butchers cut. We all have a job to do. (Lawful)
results.2-2: Perspective. If you ask a monster, we’re the meat. (Neutral)
results.3-3: Control. Control what people need and you control the people. (Evil)
results.4-4: Generosity. You never know when giving away a scrap might brighten a day or save a life. (Good)
results.5-5: Casualness. Why bother measuring? A little less here, a little extra there: it all evens out. (Chaotic)
results.6-6: Practicality. If your choice is between eating or being eaten, choose the former. (Any)

results.1-1: I consider myself an artist, a painter of sorts, and my patrons are the canvas. I create for art’s sake.
results.2-2: I stumbled into this role quite by accident. It’s a funny story involving a very hairy monster. You know, the one from that famous story.
results.3-3: I never planned on being a barber long term, but once I met my partner, I felt like I couldn’t walk away from it.
results.4-4: My father was a barber, and I was expected to take up the trade when he retired.
results.5-5: I got swept up in the last war barbering for the soldiers in camp during the campaign. I made a few friends among them along the way.
results.6-6: I once gave a haircut so bad that the recipient still tries to make my life miserable whenever they can

results.1-1: I protected the same person throughout my entire career.
results.2-2: I still bear a great shame for failing to protect one of my early employers.
results.3-3: I belong to a well-known agency of bodyguards.
results.4-4: One of my charges eventually became my best friend.
results.5-5: I treat all of my charges like family while they are under my care.
results.6-6: There is an assassin whom I consider my archnemesis.

results.1-1: I believe that anyone who has to pay for my protection is inferior to me.
results.2-2: I always take note of the entrances and exits whenever I enter a new place.
results.3-3: I like to learn everything I can about the people I protect.
results.4-4: I enjoy traveling to new, faraway places.
results.5-5: I find clarity in the tumult of violence.
results.6-6: I secretly resent my employers; what makes them so special?
results.7-7: I treat everyone like a potential threat.

results.1-1: A magic curse has afflicted me with wanderlust.
results.2-2: I always take a souvenir from the places I visit.
results.3-3: I used to drift from place to place with two close companions, but I haven’t seen them in a long time.
results.4-4: I make it a point to sample the best local food and drink everywhere I go.
results.5-5: The love of my life went missing, and I won’t stop looking until I find them.
results.6-6: There are several towns where I’m not welcome anymore because of some unfortunate situations and misunderstandings.

results.1-1: Law. It is important to observe the laws of the land wherever you find yourself. (Lawful)
results.2-2: Anonymity. The open road allows everyone to be a stranger. (Neutral)
results.3-3: Evasion. The best way to avoid answering for your crimes is to leave before they find you. (Evil)
results.4-4: Improvement. Leave every place better than you found it. (Good)
results.5-5: Freedom. There is no greater freedom than being beholden to nowhere and no one. (Chaotic)
results.6-6: Prudence. It’s important to know when it’s time to move on. (Any)

results.1-1: Red. The target takes [[/damage 1d12 fire average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
results.2-2: Orange. The target takes [[/damage 1d12 acid average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
results.3-3: Yellow. The target takes [[/damage 1d12 lightning average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
results.4-4: Green. The target takes [[/damage 1d12 poison average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
results.5-5: Blue. The target takes [[/damage 1d12 cold average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
results.6-6: Indigo. The target is &Refecence[restrained]{restrained} until the end of its next turn.
results.7-7: Violet. The target is &Refecence[blinded]{blinded} until the end of its next turn.
results.8-8: Special. The warget is sturck by two rays. Roll twice more, rerolling any 8.

results.1-1: I am extremely careful with my money.
results.2-2: I am perfectly willing to perform honest labor to achieve my goals.
results.3-3: I prefer the company of animals over people when it comes to traveling companions.
results.4-4: I am embarrassed by my lifestyle, so I try to conceal my nature as a drifter as much as possible.
results.5-5: Every journey is easier if you carry a song in your heart.
results.6-6: I greet everyone with a smile and a friendly word.
results.7-7: Simple entertainment and cheap thrills are my favorite diversions.
results.8-8: I avoid scrutiny and attention as much as possible.

results.1-1: Prescription. There is a right way to do any task, and barbering is no exception. (Lawful)
results.2-2: Equality. Weak or powerful, rich or poor, everyone desires to look their best if they can help it. (Neutral)
results.3-3: Leverage. No one is ever more vulnerable than when you have ears to hear and a razor to their throat. (Evil)
results.4-4: Encouragement. I’m glad when a nice shave or a smart haircut helps people feel better about themselves. (Good)
results.5-5: Impermanence. The wonderful thing about cutting hair is that if you don’t like how it turns out, it won’t stay like that forever. (Chaotic)
results.6-6: Dedication. Ultimately, I just want to do a good job. (Any)
